text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
- Rightwing Popular Party (PP) leader Manuel Monteiro has been re-elected PP president with more than 80 percent of the vote of his party.

- The president of electricity company EDP-Electricidade de Portugal, Antonio de Almeida, said on Friday his company was considering buying 20 percent of mobile phone operator Telecel, but for less than the previously mentioned 34 billion escudos.
- Popular Party (PP) town councils will benefit from financial support from the Socialist government in 1997.
- The president of retailer Jeronimo Martins, Alexandre Soares dos Santos, in an interview with the paper, accuses the government of hindering thr growth of Portuguese retail groups.
- Public water company IPE-Aguas de Portugal is looking for investment possibilities in Brazil, Angola and Mozambique.
